questions.text: Emergency contraception prevents pregnancy by all of the following mechanisms except:

options.label: C
options.text: Preventing implantation of the fertilized egg

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Interrupting an early pregnancy Interrupting an early pregnancy is incorrect , It is not an abortifacient i.e. will not act after implantation has occurred

Highyeild:

Emergency Contraceptives are also called INTERCEPTIVES . It refers to a type of contraception that is used as an emergency to prevent pregnancy after unprotected intercourse. Emergency Contraception It can be started up to five days (120 hours) after unprotected intercourse but the greatest Protection occurs if it is given within 72 hours of unprotected sex. Emergency contraception is also known as emergency birth control, backup birth control, and the morning-after pill. Method of choice /M/C method used = Levonorgestrel 1.5 mg single dose (Tablet = 0.75 mg 2 tablets together) Mechanism of action The mechanism of action is not known with certainty, but it is believed with the justification that this treatment combines Delay of ovulation Prevention of fertilization. Prevents implantation by affecting endometrial lining. Spermicidal-Nonhormonal methods Indications Breakage or slipping of condom Forgot to take OC pills or insert diaphragm or sponge Diaphragm slipped out of place Miscalculated “safe” days Failure to practice coitus interruptus Not using any birth control method Forced to have unprotected vaginal sex, or were raped. M/C side effects: Nausea, vomiting There are No C/I for emergency contraceptives. E Pill is available free of cost by Govt. of India as an emergency contraceptive. The most effective method of emergency contraception CuT> Ulipristal > LNG tablet Note: LNG IUCD and progesterone-only pills are not emergency contraceptives ' Hence Option A, Option C, Option B are correct options

Extraedge:

Drugs used for Emergency Contraception Levonorgestrel tablet-0.75 mg stat and after 12 hours or 1.5 mg as a single dose. Yuzpe method – OCPs with 50 μg ethinyl estradiol 2 tablets twice 12 hours Apart OCPs with 30 μg EE – 4 tablets twice 12 hours apart Mifepristone (100 mg single dose mg soon as possible. Anti-implantation in action) Danazol Ulipristal (Synthetic Progesterone Receptor Modulator). Delays ovulation. Dose = 30 mg. Single dose to be taken within 5 days. IUCD insertion within 5 days of unprotected sex. Centchroman 2 tablets (60 mg) twice 24 hours within 24 hours of intercourse.

questions.text: Emergency contraceptives are effective if administered within the following period after unprotected intercourse:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

120 hours Emergency Contraception It can be started up to five days (120 hours) after unprotected intercourse but the greatest protection occurs if it is given within 72 hours of unprotected sex. Emergency contraception is also known as emergency birth control, backup birth control, and the morning-after pill. Method of choice /M/C method used = Levonorgestrel 1.5 mg single dose (Tablet = 0.75 mg 2 tablets together)

Random:

Options A, B, and C are incorrect.

Extraedge:

Yuzpe method – OCPs with 50 μg ethinyl estradiol 2 tablets twice 12 hours Apart OCPs with 30 μg EE – 4 tablets twice 12 hours apart Mifepristone (100 mg single dose mg soon as possible. Anti-implantation in action) Danazol Ulipristal ( Synthetic Progesterone Receptor Modulator). Delays ovulation. Dose = 30 mg. Single dose to be taken within 5 days. IUCD insertion within 5 days of unprotected sex. Centchroman 2 tablets (60 mg) twice 24 hours within 24 hours of intercourse.
